title: Patriot missile production is surging, but the demand is insatiable
summary:
US Army EuropeAmerican defense companies are cranking out Patriot interceptors at a record-breaking pace, but demand is surging.
Amid global conflicts and growing worries in the West about a major conflict against a peer-level adversary, air defense missiles are in huge demand.
Meanwhile, Boeing is surging PAC-3 missile seekers, critical components that enable the Patriot system to identify, track, and intercept threats, and Raytheon, which makes Patriot radars and launchers, is boosting PAC-2 interceptor missile production.
A Patriot Air and Missile Defense launcher fires an interceptor.
RaytheonHoffman cautioned that even if the West's production of missile interceptors, like the Patriots, exceeds Russian conventional ballistic missile production, "this will not solve Europe's problems."

title: The unlikely bond between JD Vance and David Lammy
summary:
Faith, family and fishing: The unlikely bond between JD Vance and David Lammy3 days ago Share Save Kate Whannel Political reporter Share SavePA Media JD Vance and David Lammy fishing together at Chevening in KentUS Vice President JD Vance is taking his holiday in the UK - a trip which will include visits to the Cotswolds, Scotland and, to kick it all off, a few days staying with Foreign Secretary David Lammy at his grace-and-favour country home, Chevening House in Kent.
Yet, despite their differences Lammy and Vance appear to be the best of friends.
Vance went to Harvard's rival Yale - "not quite as good," Lammy joked at Chevening.
Vance converted to Catholicism as an adult and attended Mass with Lammy when he visited Washington DC earlier this year.
The vice president is also meeting Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch and Reform UK's Nigel Farage has hinted that he may be as well.

title: Nvidia Just Dodged an $8 Billion Bullet, Thanks to Donald Trump
summary:
According to the Financial Times, the breakthrough came after Huang’s visit to the White House on August 6 to meet with President Donald Trump.
To prevent this, the U.S. has imposed strict export controls, blocking the sale of top-tier AI chips to China.
The Power of Personal DiplomacyReversing this policy took months of intense diplomacy and lobbying, culminating in Huang’s personal visits to the White House.
During a White House AI summit last month, Trump admitted he had initially considered taking antitrust action against the chip giant before he got to know its CEO.
With the $8 billion revenue threat now averted and the $50 billion China market reopened, investors will be watching closely when Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings later this month.

title: China Opens ‘Robot Mall,’ Its First Mall for Robots
summary:
The four-story Robot Mall, located in Beijing’s high-tech E-Town district, showcases more than 100 robots from over 40 brands, including Chinese companies like Ubtech Robotics and Unitree Robotics.
The opening of Robot Mall coincides with two major robotics conferences in the city this month.
Friday was also the first day of the 2025 World Robot Conference, which runs through August 12.
Just days later, Beijing will host the 2025 World Humanoid Robot Games, taking place from August 14 to 17.
Some U.S. robotics companies, including Tesla and Boston Dynamics, have already called on lawmakers to develop a national strategy that can compete with China’s.

title: Vance in UK for high-stakes diplomacy day after Trump announces Putin meeting
summary:
President Donald Trump in Washington, Aug. 6, 2025, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Rome, July 10, 2025 and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow, Aug. 5, 2025.
President Donald Trump in Washington, Aug. 6, 2025, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Rome, July 10, 2025 and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow, Aug. 5, 2025.
President Donald Trump in Washington, Aug. 6, 2025, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Rome, July 10, 2025 and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow, Aug. 5, 2025.
President Donald Trump in Washington, Aug. 6, 2025, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Rome, July 10, 2025 and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow, Aug. 5, 2025.
The UK meeting came as the upcoming Trump-Putin summit -- set to happen without Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky at the table -- has raised concern among Ukrainian officials and across Europe.

title: The top cities where the ultrawealthy are buying second homes in 2025 — and it's not just London or New York
summary:
Ultra-high-net-worth buyers are flocking to Miami for second homes, drawn by its tax perks, lifestyle, and climate.
Ultra-high-net-worth buyers are flocking to Miami for second homes, drawn by its tax perks, lifestyle, and climate.
Jeff Greenberg/Jeffrey Greenberg/Universal Images Group via Getty ImagesUltra-high-net-worth buyers are flocking to Miami for second homes, drawn by its tax perks, lifestyle, and climate.
A new report by wealth intelligence firm Altrata ranked the top 20 cities where ultra-high-net-worth individuals — defined as those with a net worth of at least $30 million — are buying second homes in 2025.
The top 20 cities for second homes in 2025The report ranked cities by the number of UHNW individuals who own a second residence in each location, looking at both US cities and cities in the rest of the world.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Goes on Fiery Tirade Against ‘Psychopath’ Fox News Host Mark Levin
summary:
Fox News personality Mark Levin started the heated feud when he attacked the Georgia Republican on X.
“Fox News host Mark Levin is a raging psychopath,” she wrote on X.
All because I am UNAPOLOGETICALLY AMERICA FIRST and UNAPOLOGETICALLY FIGHTING FOR MY CHILDREN’S GENERATION!!
!”Fox News host Mark Levin is a raging psychopath.
Fox News host Mark Levin, a once hateful NEVER TRUMPER, is 100% Israel FIRST and America LAST!!

title: Trump’s disastrous nuclear policies once held a glimmer of hope
summary:
In an Oval Office press meeting, for the first time in decades, a sitting president openly discussed nuclear disarmament: “There’s no reason for us to be building brand new nuclear weapons.
And here we are building new nuclear weapons, and they’re building nuclear weapons,” he said.
Even if he deterred Iran’s nuclear program, it put the U.S. directly at odds with other nuclear powers.
But right now, we’re on the wrong path — the path of excessive militarization and the risk of total annihilation.
And the Pentagon is spending $2 trillion on a whole new generation of nuclear weapons.

title: Russia and Ukraine exchange drone attacks amid peace talks maneuvers
summary:
People look at a destroyed Russian combat drone at an exhibition in central Kyiv, Ukraine, on August 8, 2025.
People look at a destroyed Russian combat drone at an exhibition in central Kyiv, Ukraine, on August 8, 2025.
People look at a destroyed Russian combat drone at an exhibition in central Kyiv, Ukraine, on August 8, 2025.
People look at a destroyed Russian combat drone at an exhibition in central Kyiv, Ukraine, on August 8, 2025.
Russia's Defense Ministry said its troops shot down at least 126 Ukrainian drones overnight.
